KS Comments:

(i) can be resolved easily with the MF15 formula.
(ii), students can actually plot the entire graph of t against v into the graphing calculator and calculate the v when t = 1. They should draw the graph out then. Should they do this, (c) will be solved conveniently.

KS Comments:

This is fairly good question. The first part explores students’ abilities to relate a 3-variables differential equation. In (iv), they are expected to understand the question first and set the arbitrary constants to the necessary conditions. Don’t forget to use the graphing calculator to draw the graphs!

Personal Comments:
Some students will overlook to make in terms of and are careless when it comes to completing the square. For (iiia), some students did not identify that the initial mass was 0.5g and half of it refers to 0.25g. As for (iv), it is certainly very tedious, but there are a lot of marks, just do it carefully. Many students overlook the given range for values too, and do label the graph when and .
